additive.name: Curcumin
additive.comment: Derived from the root of the curcuma (turmeric) plant, but can be artificially produced; used in cheese, margarine, baked sweets and fish fingers

additive.name: Riboflavin
additive.comment: Occurs naturally in green vegetables, eggs, milk, liver and kidney; used in margarine and cheese

additive.name: Riboflavin-5'-phosphate
additive.comment: Occurs naturally in green vegetables, eggs, milk, liver and kidney; used in margarine and cheese

additive.name: Tartrazine
additive.comment: Known to provoke asthma attacks and urticaria (nettle rash) in children (the US FDA estimates 1:10 000); also linked to thyroid tumors, chromosomal damage, urticaria (hives) and hyperactivity; tartrazine sensitivity is also linked to aspirin sensitivity; used to colour drinks, sweets, jams, cereals, snack foods, canned fish, packaged soups; banned in Norway and Austria

additive.name: Quinoline Yellow
additive.comment: Used in lipsticks hair products, colognes; also in a wide range of medications; cause dermatitis; banned in Australia, USA and Norway

additive.name: Yellow 7G
additive.comment: People who suffer Asthma may also show an allergic reaction to it; typical products are soft drinks; banned in Australia and USA

additive.name: Sunset Yellow FCF
additive.altname: Orange Yellow S, FD&C Yellow No.6
additive.comment: Used in cereals, bakery, sweets, snack foods, ice cream, drinks and canned fish; synthetic; also in many medications including Berocca, Polaramine, Ventolin syrup; side effects are urticaria (hives), rhinitis (runny nose), nasal congestion, allergies, hyperactivity, kidney tumors, chromosomal damage, abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting, indigestion, distaste for food; seen increased incidence of tumours in animals; banned in Norway

additive.name: Cochineal
additive.comment: Red coloring, made from crushed beatles; rarely used.

additive.name: Azorubine
additive.comment: Red color; coal tar derivative; can produce bad reactions in asthmatics and people allergic to aspirin; typical products are confectionary, marzipan, jelly crystals; banned in Sweden, USA, Austria and Norway

additive.name: Amaranth
additive.comment: Derived from the small herbaceous plant of the same name; used in cake mixes, fruit-flavoured fillings, jelly crystals; can provoke asthma, eczema and hyperactivity; it caused birth defects and foetal deaths in some animal tests, possibly also cancer; banned in the USA, Russia, Austria and Norway and other countries

additive.name: Ponceau 4R
additive.altname: Cochineal Red A, FD&C Red No.4
additive.comment: Synthetic coal tar and azo dye, carcinogen in animals, can produce bad reactions in asthmatics and people allergic to aspirin; banned in USA & Norway

additive.name: Erythrosine
additive.comment: Red color used in cherries, canned fruit, custard mix, sweets, bakery, snack foods; can cause sensitivity to light; can increase thyroid hormone levels and lead to hyperthyroidism, was shown to cause thyroid cancer in rats in a study in 1990; banned in January 1990; banned in Norway

additive.name: Red 2G
additive.comment: Banned in Australia and many other places except UK

additive.name: Allura Red AC
additive.comment: Orange-red color used in sweets, drinks and condiments, medications and cosmetics, synthetic; introduced in the early eighties to replace amaranth which was considered not safe due to conflicting test results; allura red has also been connected with cancer in mice; banned in Denmark, Belgium, France, Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, Austria and Norway

additive.name: Patent Blue V
additive.comment: Banned in Australia, USA and Norway

additive.name: Indigotine
additive.comment: Commonly added to tablets and capsules; also used in ice cream, sweets, baked goods, confectionary, biscuits, synthetic coal tar derivative; may cause nausea, vomiting, high blood pressure, skin rashes, breathing problems and other allergic reactions. banned in Norway

additive.name: Brilliant blue FCF
additive.comment: Used in dairy products, sweets and drinks, synthetic usually occurring as aluminum lake (solution) or ammonium salt; banned in Belgium, France, Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, Austria, Norway

additive.name: Chlorophylis
additive.comment: Green color occurs naturally in all plants; used for dyeing waxes and oils, used in medicines and cosmetics

additive.name: Copper complexes of chloropyll and chlorophyllins
additive.comment: Olive color, no adverse effects are known

additive.name: Green S
additive.comment: Green color; synthetic coal tar derivative; used in canned peas, mint jelly and sauce, packet bread crumbs and cake mixes; banned inSweden, USA and Norway

additive.name: Caramel
additive.comment: Dark brown color derived from sucrose; Used in soft drinks; oyster, soy, fruit and canned sauces; beer, whiskey, biscuits and pickles.

additive.name: Caustic sulphite caramel
additive.comment: Dark brown color derived from sucrose; Used in soft drinks; oyster, soy, fruit and canned sauces; beer, whiskey, biscuits and pickles.

additive.name: Ammonia caramel
additive.comment: Dark brown color derived from sucrose; Used in soft drinks; oyster, soy, fruit and canned sauces; beer, whiskey, biscuits and pickles.

additive.name: Sulphite ammonia caramel
additive.comment: Dark brown color derived from sucrose; Used in soft drinks; oyster, soy, fruit and canned sauces; beer, whiskey, biscuits and pickles.

additive.name: Brilliant Black BN
additive.comment: Colour; coal tar derivative; used in brown sauces, blackcurrant cake mixes; banned in Denmark, Australia, Belgium, France, Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, Austria, USA, Norway

additive.name: Vegetable carbon
additive.comment: Black colour, charcoal pigment; used in jams, jelly crystals, liquorice; only the vegetable derived variety permitted in Australia, banned in the United States

additive.name: Brown FK
additive.comment: Banned in USA

additive.name: Brown HT
additive.comment: Brown color, coal tar and azo dye; used in chocolate cake mixes; can produce bad reactions in asthmatics and people allergic to aspirin; also known to induce skin sensitivity; banned in Denmark, Belgium, France, Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, Austria, USA, Norway

additive.name: Carotene
additive.comment: Orange-yellow colour; human body converts it to 'Vitamin A' in the liver, found in carrots and other yellow or orange fruits and vegetables

additive.name: Annatto
additive.comment: Red color; derived from a tree (Bixa orellana); used as a body paint, fabric dye, digestive aid and expectorant; used to dye cheese, butter, margarine, cereals, snack foods, soaps, textiles and varnishes; known to cause urticaria (nettle rash), the HACSG* recommends to avoid it

additive.name: Lycopene
additive.comment: Red coloured carotenoid found in tomatoes and pink grapefruit, can cause decreasing risk of cancer

additive.name: Beta-apo-8'-carotenal (C 30)
additive.comment: Orange color, no adverse effects are known

additive.name: Ethyl ester of beta-apo-8'-carotenic acid (C 30)
additive.comment: Orange color, no adverse effects are known

additive.name: Lutein
additive.comment: Yellow color derived from plants, naturally found in green leaves, marigolds and egg yolks

additive.name: Canthaxanthin
additive.comment: Yellow color possibly derived from animal sources (retinol); the pigment is found in some mushrooms, crustacea, fish, flamingo feathers

additive.name: Beetroot Red
additive.comment: Purple color derived from beets; no adverse effects are known

additive.name: Anthocyanins
additive.comment: Violet color matter of flowers and plants; seems safe

additive.name: Calcium carbonate
additive.comment: Mineral salt, used in toothpastes, white paint and cleaning powders; may be derived from rock mineral or animal bones; sometimes used to deacidify wines and firm canned fruit and veg.; toxic at 'high doses'

additive.name: Titanium dioxide
additive.comment: White color used in toothpaste and white paint, pollutes waterways; no adverse effects are known

additive.name: Iron oxides and hydroxides
additive.comment: Black, yellow, red color used in salmon and shrimp pastes; toxic at 'high doses'

additive.name: Tannic acid
additive.comment: Tannins, clarifying agent in alcohol; derived from the nutgalls and twigs of oak trees; occurs naturally in tea

additive.name: Sorbic acid
additive.comment: Either obtained from berries or synthesised from ketene; possible skin irritant

additive.name: Benzoic acid, also known as flowers of benzoin, phenlycarboxylic acid
additive.comment: Added to alcoholic beverages, baked goods, cheeses, gum, condiments, frozen dairy, relishes, soft sweets, cordials and sugar substitutes; used in cosmetics, as an antiseptic in many cough medications and an antifungal in ointments; can cause asthma, especially in those dependant on steroid asthma medications, is also reputed to cause neurological disorders and to react with sulphur bisulphite (222), shown to provoke hyperactivity in children; obtained from Benzoin, a resin exuded by trees native to Asia

additive.name: Sodium benzoate
additive.comment: Used as antiseptic, as a food preservative and to disguise taste, as of poor-quality food; orange soft drinks contain a high amount of it, upto 25mg per 250ml; also in milk and meat products, relishes and condiments, baked goods and lollies; used in many oral medications including Actifed, Phenergan and Tylenol; known to causes nettle rash and aggravate asthma

additive.name: Potassium benzoate
additive.comment: People with a history of allergies may show allergic reactions. for using see 210

additive.name: Calcium benzoate
additive.comment: See 212

additive.name: Propyl p-hydroxybenzoate
additive.comment: Possible contact allergen

additive.name: Methyl p-hydroxybenzoate
additive.comment: Allergic reactions possible, mainly affecting the skin

additive.name: Sulphur dioxide
additive.comment: Derived from coal tar; all sulphur drugs are toxic and restricted in use (in USA, FDA** prohibits their use on raw fruits and vegetables), produced by combustion of sulphur or gypsum; known to provoke asthma attacks and difficult to metabolise for those with impaired kidney function, also destroys vitamin B1; typical products are beer, soft drinks, dried fruit, juices, cordials, wine, vinegar, potato products

additive.name: Sodium sulphite
additive.comment: Decontaminating agent used in fresh orange juice

additive.name: Sodium hydrogen sulphite
additive.comment: See E220

additive.name: Sodium metabisulphite
additive.comment: Treating agent, see E220

additive.name: Potassium metabisulphite
additive.comment: See E220

additive.name: Potassium sulphite
additive.comment: See E220

additive.name: Potassium hydrogen sulphite
additive.comment: See 220

additive.name: Biphenyl
additive.comment: Banned in some countries; can be used for agricultural purposes; typical products are citrus fruit

additive.name: Orthophenyl phenol
additive.comment: Banned in some countries; can be used for agricultural purposes; typical products are pears, carrots, peaches, plums, prunes, sweet potatoe, citrus fruit, pineapples, tomatoes, peppers, cherries, nectarines

additive.name: Sodium orthophenyl phenol
additive.comment: Banned in some countries; can be used for agricultural purposes; typical products are pears, carrots, peaches, plums, prunes, sweet potatoe, citrus fruit, pineapples, tomatoes, peppers, cherries, nectarines

additive.name: Thiabendazole
additive.comment: Banned in some countries, can be used for agricultural purposes, typical products are citrus fruits, apples, pears, potatoes, bananas, mushrooms, meat, milk

additive.name: Nisin
additive.comment: Antibiotic derived from bacteria; found in beer, processed cheese products, tomato paste

additive.name: Natamycin
additive.comment: Mould inhibitor derived from bacteria; sometimes used medically to treat candidiasis; can cause nausea, vomiting, anorexia, diarrhoea and skin irritation;.typical products are meat, cheese

additive.name: Potassium nitrite
additive.comment: Colour fixative and curing agent for meat; nitrites can effect the body's ability to carry oxygen, resulting in shortness of breath, dizziness and headaches; potential carcinogen; not permitted in foods for infant and young children

additive.name: Sodium nitrite
additive.comment: May provoke hyperactivity and other adverse reactions, potentially carcinogenic, restricted in many countries, can combine with chemicals in stomach to form nitrosamine, the HACSG* recommends to avoid it

additive.name: Sodium nitrate
additive.comment: Also used in the manufacture of nitric acid, as a fertiliser and in fermented meat products (see 250)

additive.name: Potassium nitrate
additive.comment: May be derived from waste animal or vegetable matter; used in gunpowder, explosives and fertilisers, and in the preservation of meat; may provoke hyperactivity and other adverse reactions; potentially carcinogenic; restricted in many countries (see 249)

additive.name: Acetic acid
additive.comment: Main component of vinegar, synthetically produced from wood fibres; used in pickles, chutneys, and sauces

additive.name: Potassium acetate
additive.comment: Food acid; should be avoided by people with impaired kidney function; typical products are sauces, pickles

additive.name: Sodium acetate
additive.comment: Food acid, acidity regulator;

additive.name: Calcium acetate
additive.comment: Food acid, acidity regulator; by product in the manufacture of wood alcohol; used to make acetic acid (vinegar) and in the production of dyers mordants

additive.name: Ammonium acetate
additive.comment: Can cause nausea and vomiting

additive.name: Lactic acid
additive.comment: Food acid, acidity regulator; produced by heating and fermenting carbohydrates in milk whey, potatoes, cornstarch or molasses; difficult for babies to metabolise; used in sweets, dressings, soft drinks (sometimes beer) infant formulas and confectionary

additive.name: Propionic acid
additive.comment: All propionates are thought to be linked with migraine headaches; propionates occur naturally in fermented foods, human perspiration and ruminants digestive tract, also can be derived commercially from ethylene and carbon monoxide or propionaldehyde or natural gas or fermented wood pulp; produced when bacteria decompose fibre; commonly used in bread and flour products;

additive.name: Sodium propionate
additive.comment: May be linked to migraines, typical products are flour products

additive.name: Calcium propionate
additive.comment: May be linked to migraines, typical products are flour products

additive.name: Potassium propionate
additive.comment: May be linked to migraines, typical products are flour products

additive.name: Carbon dioxide
additive.comment: Propellant, coolant, derived from lime manufacture; may increase the effect of alcohol; typical products are wine, soft drinks, confectionary

additive.name: Malic acid
additive.comment: Derived from fruit or synthetic; infants and young children should avoid it

additive.name: Fumaric acid
additive.comment: Derived from plants of the genus Fumaria esp. F.officianalis or from the fermentation of glucose with fungi; can be used to flavour, acidify, as an antioxidant or raising agentused in soft drinks and cake mixes

additive.name: Ascorbic acid
additive.comment: Flour treating agent, 'vitamin C'; may be made synthetically from glucose, naturally occurs in fruit and vegetables; added to products as diverse as cured meat, breakfast cereals, frozen fish and wine

additive.name: Sodium ascorbate
additive.comment: Sodium salt of vitamin C

additive.name: Calcium ascorbate
additive.comment: Calcium salt of vitamin C, may increase the formation of calcium axalate stones

additive.name: Potassium ascorbate
additive.comment: Potassium salt of vitamin C

additive.name: Ascorbyl palmitate
additive.comment: Fatty acid esters of ascorbic acid, same function as E300

additive.name: Tocopherol-rich extract
additive.comment: Antioxidant. Found in many vegetable oils, including soy, wheat germ, rice germ, cottonseed, maize; works as an antioxidant for fatty acids and tissue fats, preventing vitamin A from oxidation; used in margarine and salad dressings

additive.name: alpha-tocopherol
additive.comment: Antioxidant. Found in many vegetable oils, including soy, wheat germ, rice germ, cottonseed, maize; works as an antioxidant for fatty acids and tissue fats, preventing vitamin A from oxidation; used in margarine and salad dressings

additive.name: gamma-tocopherol
additive.comment: Antioxidant. Found in many vegetable oils, including soy, wheat germ, rice germ, cottonseed, maize; works as an antioxidant for fatty acids and tissue fats, preventing vitamin A from oxidation; used in margarine and salad dressings

additive.name: delta-tocopherol
additive.comment: Antioxidant. Found in many vegetable oils, including soy, wheat germ, rice germ, cottonseed, maize; works as an antioxidant for fatty acids and tissue fats, preventing vitamin A from oxidation; used in margarine and salad dressings

additive.name: Propyl gallate
additive.comment: Used to prevent rancidity in oily substances; derived from nutgalls; may cause gastric or skin irritation, gallates are not permitted in foods for infants and small children because of their known tendency to cause the blood disorder, methemoglobinemia; used in oils, margarine, lard and salad dressings, sometimes used in packaging

additive.name: Octyl gallate
additive.comment: Used to prevent rancidity in oily substances; derived from nutgalls; may cause gastric or skin irritation, gallates are not permitted in foods for infants and small children because of their known tendency to cause the blood disorder, methemoglobinemia; used in oils, margarine, lard and salad dressings, sometimes used in packaging

additive.name: Dodecyl gallate
additive.comment: Used to prevent rancidity in oily substances; derived from nutgalls; may cause gastric or skin irritation, gallates are not permitted in foods for infants and small children because of their known tendency to cause the blood disorder, methemoglobinemia; used in oils, margarine, lard and salad dressings, sometimes used in packaging

additive.name: Erythorbic acid
additive.comment: Produced from sucrose

additive.name: Sodium erythorbate
additive.comment: Produced from Erythorbic acid (E317) which is derived from sucrose

additive.name: Tert-ButylHydroQuinone (TBHQ)
additive.comment: Petroleum based; May cause nausea, vomiting, delirium. Typical products are fats, oils, margarine

additive.name: Butylated hydroxy-anisole (BHA)
additive.comment: Petroleum derivative, retards spoilage due to oxidation; used in edible oils, chewing gum, fats, margarine, nuts, instant potato products, polyethylene food wraps; not permitted in infant foods, can provoke an allergic reaction in some people, may trigger hyperactivity and other intolerances; serious concerns over carcinogenicity and estrogenic effects, in large doses caused tumors in lab animals.

additive.name: Butylated hydroxy-toluene (BHT)
additive.comment: Petroleum derivative; see E320

additive.name: Lecithins
additive.comment: Emulsifier derived from soy beans, egg yolks, peanuts, corn or animal resources; non toxic but overdose can upset the stomach, kill the appetite and cause profuse sweating; used to allow combination of oils in margarine, chocolate, mayonnaise, milk powder; must be choosen vegetable type

additive.name: Sodium lactate
additive.comment: Derived from milk (lactic acid); may contain pork rennin or whey in process, young children with lactose intolerance may show adverse reactions

additive.name: Potassium lactate
additive.comment: Derived from milk (lactic acid); may contain pork rennin or whey in process, young children with lactose intolerance may show adverse reactions

additive.name: Calcium lactate
additive.comment: Derived from milk (lactic acid); may contain pork rennin or whey in process, young children with lactose intolerance may show adverse reactions

additive.name: Ammonium lactate
additive.comment: Derived from milk (lactic acid); may contain pork rennin or whey in process, young children with lactose intolerance may show adverse reactions

additive.name: Magnesium lactate
additive.comment: Derived from milk (lactic acid); may contain pork rennin or whey in process, young children with lactose intolerance may show adverse reactions

additive.name: Citric acid
additive.comment: Food acid, naturally derived from citrus fruit, used in biscuits, canned fish, cheese and processed cheese products, infant formulas, cake and soup mixes, rye bread, soft drinks, fermented meat products

additive.name: Sodium citrates
additive.comment: Food acid;

additive.name: Potassium citrates
additive.comment: Food acid;

additive.name: Calcium citrates
additive.comment: Food acid; in small quantities

additive.name: Tartaric acid
additive.comment: Food acid, obtained from unripe fruit, grape juice; in small quantities

additive.name: Sodium tartrates
additive.comment: Food acid;

additive.name: Potassium tartrates
additive.comment: Food acid;

additive.name: Sodium potassium tartrate
additive.comment: Food acid;

additive.name: Phosphoric acid
additive.comment: Food acid, derived from phosphate ore; used in cheese products;

additive.name: Sodium phosphates
additive.comment: Mineral salt, used as a laxative and a fixing agent in textile dyeing; high intakes may upset the calcium/phosphorus equilibrium

additive.name: Potassium phosphates
additive.comment: Mineral salt, used as a laxative and a fixing agent in textile dyeing; high intakes may upset the calcium/phosphorus equilibrium

additive.name: Calcium phosphates
additive.comment: Mineral salt found in rocks and bones; used in medicines as an antacid and polishing agent in enamels

additive.name: Magnesium phosphates
additive.comment: Essential mineral, anticaking agent found in salt substitutes

additive.name: Adipic acid
additive.comment: Food acid from the root adipose (pertaining to fat?)

additive.name: Sodium fumarate
additive.comment: Food acid, salt of fumaric acid (derived from plants of the genus Fumaria esp. F.officianalis)

additive.name: Niacin
additive.comment: Naturally occurs in bean, pea and other legumes, milk, egg, meat, poultry, and fish; at doses in excess of 1,000 mg per day can cause liver damage, diabetes, gastritis, eye damage, and elevated blood levels of uric acid (which can cause gout); at amounts as low as 50-100 mg may cause flushing (harmless but painful), headache, and stomachache especially if taken on an empty stomach

additive.name: Tri-ammonium citrate
additive.comment: May interfere with liver and pancreas function

additive.name: Ammonium ferric citrates
additive.comment: Essential mineral, food acid derived from citric acid; used as a dietary iron supplement in breakfast cereals and dietary formulas

additive.name: Alginic acid
additive.comment: Thickener and vegetable gum, derived from seaweed; used in custard mix, cordial, flavoured milk, ice blocks, thickened cream and yoghurt; in small quantities, large quantities can inhibit the absorption of some nutrients

additive.name: Sodium alginate
additive.comment: Thickener and vegetable gum, derived from seaweed; used in custard mix, cordial, flavoured milk, ice blocks, thickened cream and yoghurt; in small quantities, large quantities can inhibit the absorption of some nutrients

additive.name: Potassium alginate
additive.comment: Thickener and vegetable gum, derived from seaweed; used in custard mix, cordial, flavoured milk, ice blocks, thickened cream and yoghurt; in small quantities, large quantities can inhibit the absorption of some nutrients

additive.name: Ammonium alginate
additive.comment: Thickener and vegetable gum, derived from seaweed; used in custard mix, cordial, flavoured milk, ice blocks, thickened cream and yoghurt; in small quantities, large quantities can inhibit the absorption of some nutrients

additive.name: Calcium alginate
additive.comment: Thickener and vegetable gum, derived from seaweed; used in custard mix, cordial, flavoured milk, ice blocks, thickened cream and yoghurt; in small quantities, large quantities can inhibit the absorption of some nutrients

additive.name: Propylene glycol alginate
additive.comment: Thickener and vegetable gum, derived from petroleum; see separate entry

additive.name: Agar
additive.comment: Thickener and vegetable gum derived from red seaweed; sometimes used as a laxative, found in manufactured meats and ice cream

additive.name: Carrageenan
additive.comment: A fibre extracted from seaweed, it has recently been linked with cancer because it may become contaminated when ethylene oxide is added to an inferior product, this results in ethylene chlorohydrin forming, a highly carcinogenic compound; linked to toxic hazards, including ulcers and cancer; the most serious concerns relate to degraded carrageenan, which is not a permitted additive; however, native carrageenan, which is used, may become degraded in the gut

additive.name: Locust bean gum
additive.comment: Derived from Carob or Locust bean tree Ceratonia siliqua; used in lollies, cordials, essences, some flour products, dressings, fruit juice drinks; frequently used as a caffeine-free chocolate substitute; may lower cholesterol levels

additive.name: Guar gum
additive.comment: Derived from the seeds of Cyamoposis tetragonolobus of Indian origin; fed to cattle in the US; can cause nausea, flatulence and cramps, may reduced cholesterol levels

additive.name: Tragacanth
additive.comment: Resin form the tree Astragalus gummifer; used in foods, drugs including nasal solutions, elixirs and tablets; also used as a binder in cosmetics; possible contact allergy

additive.name: Acacia
additive.comment: Derived from the sap of Acacia Sengal; easily broken down by the human digestive system; possible allergen, soothes irritations of mucous membranes

additive.name: Xanthan gum
additive.comment: Derived from the fermentation of corn sugar with a bacterium

additive.name: Karaya gum
additive.comment: Derived from the tree Sterculia urens; often used in conjunction with Carob (E 410), in ice cream, custard and sweets, as a filler for its capability to multiply its volume by 100 times with the additon of water; possible allergen

additive.name: Tara gum
additive.comment: Derived from the tara bush, Caesalpinia Spinosa is indigenous to Equador and Peru and is grown in Kenya

additive.name: Sorbitol
additive.comment: Artificial sweetener and humectant; derived from glucose, either obtained from berries or synthesised; used in lollies, dried fruit, pastries, confectionary, low calorie foods, pharmecuetical syrups and opthalmic preparations and is the seventh most widely used preservative in cosmetics; not permitted in foods for infants and young children, can cause gastric disturbance

additive.name: Mannitol
additive.comment: Artificial sweetener and humectant; derived from seaweed or the manna ash tree; possible allergen, not permitted in infant foods due to its ability to cause diarrhea and kidney dysfunction, also may cause nausea, vomiting; typical products are low calorie foods

additive.name: Glycerol
additive.comment: Humectant and sweetener; oily colourless alcohol; derived by decomposition of natural fats with alkalis; usually as a by-product of soap making using animal fat or vegetable oil; can be obtained from petroleum products sometimes synthesised from propylene or fermented from sugar; used in flexible coatings on sausages and cheeses, also in crystallised and dried fruit, liqueurs and vodka. Glycerin has been shown to protect against DNA damage induced by tumor promoters, ultraviolet lights and radiation, presumably via free radical scavenging; large quantities can cause headaches, thirst, nausea and high blood sugar levels. typical products are liquers, confectionary, dried fruit, low calorie foods

additive.name: Konjac
additive.comment: (i) Konjac gum (ii) Konjac glucomannane. Emulsifier.

additive.name: Polyoxyethylene (8) stearate
additive.comment: Emulsifier, stabiliser.

additive.name: Polyoxyethylene (40) stearate
additive.comment: Emulsifier.

additive.name: Polysorbate 20
additive.comment: Emulsifiers derived from animal fatty acids; used as sythetic flavourings, surfactants, defoaming agents and dough conditioners; may increase the absorption of fat-soluble substances

additive.name: Polysorbate 80
additive.comment: Emulsifiers derived from animal fatty acids; used as sythetic flavourings, surfactants, defoaming agents and dough conditioners; may increase the absorption of fat-soluble substances

additive.name: Polysorbate 40
additive.comment: Emulsifiers derived from animal fatty acids; used as sythetic flavourings, surfactants, defoaming agents and dough conditioners; may increase the absorption of fat-soluble substances

additive.name: Polyoxyethylene (20)
additive.comment: Emulsifiers derived from animal fatty acids; used as sythetic flavourings, surfactants, defoaming agents and dough conditioners; may increase the absorption of fat-soluble substances

additive.name: Polyoxyethylene (20)
additive.comment: Emulsifiers derived from animal fatty acids; used as sythetic flavourings, surfactants, defoaming agents and dough conditioners; may increase the absorption of fat-soluble substances

additive.name: Pectin
additive.comment: Naturally occurring in the skins of apples; used to thicken jams, jellies and sauces; large quantities may cause temporary flatulence or intestinal discomfort

additive.name: Gelatine
additive.comment: Possible allergen, may contain 220, asthmatics and people allergic to sulphites beware!

additive.name: Diphosphates
additive.comment: High intakes may upset the calcium/phosphate equilibrium

additive.name: Triphosphates
additive.comment: Pentasodium Triphosphate, Pentapotassium Triphosphate

additive.name: Polyphosphates
additive.comment: iSodium Polyphosphate, (ii)Potassium Polyphosphate, (iii)Sodium Calcium Polyphosphate, (iv)Calcium Polyphosphates, I Sodium Hexametaphosphate

additive.name: Cellulose
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent; no adverse effects known

additive.name: Methyl cellulose
additive.comment: Can cause flatulence, distension, intestinal obstruction

additive.name: Cross linked sodium carboxy methyl cellulose
Fatty acids salts
additive.comment: Sodium, potassium and calcium salts of fatty acids. Emulsifier & Anti-caking agent

additive.name: Fatty acids salts
additive.comment: Magnesium salts of fatty acids

additive.name: Mono- & di- glycerides of fatty acids

additive.comment: Acetic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids. Emulsifier.
Lactic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Citric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Mono- and diacetyl tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Mixed acetic and tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

additive.name: Propylene glycol esters of fatty acids
additive.comment: Derived from petroleum;
Lactylated fatty acid esters of gylcerol and propane-1,2-diol
Thermally oxidized soya bean oil interacted with mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids

additive.name: Sorbitan tristearate
additive.comment: May increase th absorption of fat-soluble substances

additive.name: Ammonium carbonates
additive.comment: Irritant to mucous membranes

additive.name: Magnesium carbonate
additive.comment: Medically used as an antacid and laxative

additive.name: Hydrochloric acid
additive.comment: Safe in small quantities

additive.name: Potassium chloride
additive.comment: Large quantities can cause gastric ulceration

additive.name: Calcium chloride
additive.comment: Derived from brine

additive.name: Ammonium chloride
additive.comment: Should be avoided by people with impaired liver or kidney function. Typical products are flour products

additive.name: Magnesium chloride
additive.comment: Magnesium is an essential mineral

additive.name: Sodium sulphates
additive.comment: May upset the body's water balance

additive.name: Calcium sulphate
additive.comment: Derived from limestone

additive.name: Magnesium sulphate
additive.comment: A laxative

additive.name: Copper sulphate
additive.comment: Essential mineral

additive.name: Aluminium sulfate
additive.comment: Firming Agent

additive.name: Aluminium sodium sulfate
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Aluminium potassium sulfate
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Aluminium ammonium sulfate
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Sodium hydroxide
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Potassium hydroxide
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Calcium hydroxide
additive.comment: Firming Agent. No adverse effects in small quantities

additive.name: Ammonium hydroxide
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Magnesium hydroxide
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Calcium oxide
additive.comment: Acidity regulator, Improving agent

additive.name: Magnesium oxide
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Sodium ferrocyanide
additive.comment: Acidity regulator, Improving agent

additive.name: Potassium ferrocyanide
additive.comment: By-product of coal gas production; low toxicity

additive.name: Dicalcium diphosphate
additive.comment: Acidity regulator

additive.name: Edible Bone phosphate
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent; Derived from bones; used in dried milk for coffee machines

additive.name: Silicon dioxide
additive.comment: No adverse effects are known in food use

additive.name: Calcium silicate
additive.comment: Derived from limestone and diatomaceous earth (the silicified skeletons of diatoms, a single celled plankton), antacid;

additive.name: Magnesium silicates
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent; (i) Magnesium silicate (ii), Magnesium trisilicate

additive.name: Talc
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent; typical products are polished rice, chocolate, confectionary

additive.name: Sodium aluminium silicate
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent; Used in salt, dried milk substitutes and flours

additive.name: Calcium aluminium silicate
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent; Used in salt, dried milk substitutes and flours.

additive.name: Bentonite
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent

additive.name: Aluminium silicate (Kaolin)
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent

additive.name: Stearic acid
additive.comment: Anti-caking agent. Possibly of animal origin; see stearates

additive.name: Magnesium stearate
additive.comment: Emulsifier, Anti-caking agent

additive.name: Glucono delta-lactone
additive.comment: Acidity regulator, Sequestrant

additive.name: Calcium gluconate
additive.comment: Firming Agent

additive.name: Ferrous gluconate
additive.comment: Colour-retention agent; derived from iron and glucose; used in olives, iron supplements; safe in small amounts

additive.name: Glutamic acid
additive.comment: Flavour enhancer, salt substitute; amino acid present in many animal and vegetable proteins, derived commercially from bacteria; might cause similar problems as MSG(621), young children should avoid it

additive.name: Monosodium glutamate
additive.comment: Flavour enhancer derived from the fermentation of molasses, salt substitute; adverse effects appear in some asthmatic people, not permitted in foods for infants and young children; typical products are canned vegetables, canned tuna, dressings, many frozen foods

additive.name: Monopotassium glutamate
additive.comment: Can cause nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal cramps; typical products are low sodium salt substitutes

additive.name: Calcium diglutamate
additive.comment: Salt substitute,

additive.name: Monoammonium glutamate
additive.comment: Salt substitute,

additive.name: Magnesium diglutamate
additive.comment: Salt substitute,

additive.name: Guanylic acid
additive.comment: May trigger gout

additive.name: Disodium guanylate
additive.comment: Sodium Guanylate, Flavour enhancer. Isolated from sardines or yeast extract; may trigger gout, not permitted in foods for infants and young children

additive.name: Calcium guanylate
additive.comment: May trigger gout

additive.name: Disodium inosinate
additive.comment: May be prepared from meat or sardines; may trigger gout, not permitted in foods for infants and young children

additive.name: Calcium inosinate
additive.comment: May trigger gout

additive.name: Disodium 5'-ribonucleotide
additive.comment: May be associated with itchy skin rashes up to 30 hours after ingestion; rashes may vary from mild to dramatic; the reaction is dose-related and cumulative, some individuals are more sensitive than others; typical foods include flavoured chips, instant noodles and party pies.

additive.name: Maltol
additive.comment: Derived from the bark of larch trees, pine needles, chicory wood, oils and roasted malt; it may be produced synthetically

additive.name: Ethyl maltol
additive.comment: Derived from maltol

additive.name: Glycine
additive.comment: Flavour enhancer

additive.name: Dimethyl polysiloxane
additive.comment: Silicone based

additive.name: Beeswaxes
additive.comment: Glazing agent, used to wax fruit; see bee products; occasionally causes allergic reactions

additive.name: Carnauba wax
additive.comment: Derived from a South American palm; used in cosmetics and inks, and to wax fruit; occasionally causes allergic reactions

additive.name: Shellac
additive.comment: Derived from insects; occasionally causes irritations of the skin

additive.name: Paraffins
additive.comment: May inhibit absorption of fats and fat soluble vitamins, mild laxative, there may be a link to bowel cancer; used on sweets, in processing yeast, vitamin tablets, dried fruit, confectionary, collagen

additive.name: Lanolin
additive.comment: Derived from sheep wool

additive.name: L-Cysteine hydrochloride
additive.comment: Flour treatment agent derived from animal hair and chicken feathers

additive.name: L-Cysteine hydrochloride monohydrate
additive.comment: Flour treatment agent derived from animal hair and chicken feathers

additive.name: Potassium bromate
additive.comment: Large quantities can cause nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, pain. Typical products are flour products

additive.name: Chlorine
additive.comment: Typical products are flour products. Possible health concerns.

additive.name: Chlorine dioxide
additive.comment: Typical products are flour products. Possible health concerns

additive.name: Benzoyl peroxide
additive.comment: Approved by FDA* for bleaching the carotenoids in refined flours; asthmatics and people with a history of allergies should avoid.

additive.name: Nitrogen
additive.comment: Inert gas used in freezing and vacuum packing.

additive.name: Nitrous oxide
additive.comment: Laughing Gas. Safe in small quantities

additive.name: Acesulphane potassium
additive.comment: Acesulfame K, Artificial Sweetener

additive.name: Aspartame
additive.comment: Artificial sweetener, too many adverse effects possible to list, some people are allergic to aspartame, migraine headaches a common reaction in these people

additive.name: Cyclamic acid
additive.comment: Artificial sweetener; known to cause migraines and other reactions, can be carcinogenic, caused damage ot rats testicles and mouse embriyos in tests, banned in the US and UK due its links with cancer

additive.name: Saccharines
additive.comment: Artificial sweetener derived from toluene (a known carcinogen); banned in 1977 in the US, but reinstated subject to strict labelling starting: Use of this product may be hazardous to your health, this product contains saccharin which has been determined to cause cancer in laboratory animals

additive.name: Thaumatin
additive.comment: Artificial sweetener, a protein derived from the tropical plant Thaumococcus danielli; used to sweeten wines, bread and fruit

additive.name: Maltitol
additive.comment: Humectant, starch decomposed with digestive enzymes; used in confectionery, dried fruits, low-joule foods; laxative in high concentrations

additive.name: Xylitol
additive.comment: Humectant, found in raspberries, plums, lettuce and endives, though produced for commercial purposes from wood pulp; used in low-joule foods and carbohydratemodified sweets, icecream and jams

additive.name: Quillaia extract
additive.comment: Foaming agent, emulsifier, natural surfactant; derived from chilean soap bark tree (Quillaia Saponaria); used in beer and soda; known to promote healing and reduce excessive oilness in the skin

additive.name: Amylase
additive.comment: Derived from mold mushroom or pig pancreas

additive.name: Polydextrose
additive.comment: Seems safe in small doses

additive.name: Polyvinylpyrrolidone
additive.comment: Dispersing agent, coating for tablets; used in artificial sweeteners

additive.name: Polyvinylpolypyrrolidone
additive.comment: Clarifying agent for wine, colour and colloidal stabiliser

additive.name: Dextrin
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Modified starch
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Alkaline modified starch
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Bleached starch
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Oxidized starch
additive.comment: Emulsifier and Thickening agent

additive.name: Monostarch phosphate
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Distarch phosphate
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Phosphated distarch phosphate
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Acetylated distarch phosphate
additive.comment: Emulsifier and Thickening agent

additive.name: Acetylated starch
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Acetylated starch
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Acetylated distarch adipate
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Distarch glycerine
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Hydroxy propyl starch
additive.comment: Emulsifier and Thickening agent

additive.name: Hydroxy propyl distarch glycerine
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Hydroxy propyl distarch phosphate
additive.comment: Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Starch sodium octenyl succinate
additive.comment: Emulsifier, Stabiliser and Thickening agent

additive.name: Acetylated oxidised starch
additive.comment: Emulsifier and Thickening agent

additive.name: Triethyl citrate
additive.comment: Foam Stabiliser, used in dried Egg Whites and as a carrier solvent.

additive.name: Glycerol acetates
additive.comment: Humectant and solvent derived from glycerol; used to coat fresh fruit in the US

additive.name: Glyceryl triacetate
additive.comment: (triacetin) Humectant and solvent derived from glycerol; used to coat fresh fruit in the US

additive.name: Propylene glycol
additive.comment: Humectant, wetting agent, dispersing agent, petroleum based; its glycerin like taste has made it popular for children's medications and other elixirs; used in many topical creams and ointments, cosmetics, hair products and deodorants.
